comments.content: I agree. Normally data migration template would focus on parameters/reference/ master firstly so that we can do transaction data preparation at the second step. The first template is this question, after this template is done, then go next for open stuck, then go history closed records.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BCD
I would say BCD is correct because the question stands "You must exclude historical and open order data from the database build", so Document and Transaction has to be excluded.

https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities

It's said about Document that it includes "Worksheet data that is converted into transactions later" "Examples include sales orders, purchase orders, open balances, and journals", so this is basically the open order data that we want to be excluded. About Transaction it's said "The operational transaction data of the business." "Posted transactions. These are non idempotent items such as posted invoiced and balances. Typically, these items are excluded during a full dataset copy to reduce the volume of data that is copied/migrated", so this is the historical data we also want to exclude. Based on this BCD is the correct answer.

It's ABD for me. As per the link shared previuosly:
Reference (Examples include units, dimensions, and tax codes.) 
Master (Examples include customers, vendors, and projects.) 
Document. (Examples include sales orders, purchase orders, open balances, and journals.)

Answer should be A,C, D
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities

Master - Data assets of the business. Generally, these are the "nouns" of the business, which typically fall into categories such as people, places, and concepts 
Document
Worksheet data that is converted into transactions later.
Documents that have complex structures, such a several line items for each header record. Examples include sales orders, purchase orders, open balances, and journals.
The operational data of the business.

questions.question_text:
A customer maintains a single database that will be used to create a template that includes final configuration data for a Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management implementation.
The database must contain all data required to enter sales and purchase orders into the system, including the customer and vendor data. You must exclude historical and open order data from the database build.
You need to ensure that the database includes only the relevant data.
Which three types of entity data should you use? Each correct answer presents part of the solution.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

choices.B: Use the Data validation checklist workspace

questions.question_text:
A company is starting to implement Dynamics 365 Finance.
The company has identified several data entities that are needed for an integration with other systems. The company has already enabled and disabled several configuration keys in the environment but nothing else has been configured.
You need to determine whether the necessary data entities can still be used for the integrations.
What should you do?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: D
Answer D is correct. Entity list should be refreshed. After the refresh we can see the list of Entities available.

Selected Answer: D
Run Entity list refresh. This is a correct answer because running Entity list refresh will update the list of data entities that are available for integrations. This action is required when you enable or disable configuration keys that affect the data entities.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/config-key-entities

questions.question_text:
HOTSPOT -
A company is deploying Dynamics 365 Finance.
The company must migrate customer data from a third-party system to Dynamics 365 Finance. The third-party system creates a new customer record for every unique address.
Customers that have multiple addresses have the following conditions:
✑ CustomerA owns multiple subsidiaries that operate independently.
✑ CustomerB has multiple fully-owned locations and uses centralized receivables.
✑ CustomerC has multiple operational sites.
You need to migration strategy for the customer data.
How should you migrate the data? You need to identify the features that support the expansion.
Which feature should you use? To answer, select the appropriate options in the answer area.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Hot Area:
//IMG//

questions.question_text:
DRAG DROP -
You create a new Dynamics 365 Finance instance.
You must migrate data from several third-party financial systems into a Dynamics 365 Finance instance. You gather all relevant data.
You need to map the third-party data to Dynamics 365 Finance entities.
Which entity categories should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate entity categories to the correct source data. Each entity category may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

DRAG DROP -
You are importing from a third-party e-commerce system into Dynamics 365 Finance.
The Sales Tax Code Groups data package is configured as follows:
//IMG//

You start the import process.
You need to determine when each entity will start to import.
What will the system do? To answer, drag the start imports to the appropriate entity. Each start import may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.
NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.
Select and Place:
//IMG//

comments.content:
Because of ※1,so Sales tax exempt numbers : immediately && Sales tax reporting codes : immediately ??
●Entities in different execution units are processed in parallel.※1
●In each execution unit, entities are processed in parallel if they have the same level.
●In each level, entities are processed according to their sequence number in that level.
●After one level has been processed, the next level is processed.
Can someone explain why Sales tax exempt number is immediately?
It will only run simultaniously if you have multi threading activated. Otherwise it will be one at a time

discussion.content:
Sales tax code names : immediately
Sales tax code values : After code names
Sales tax code limits : After sales tax code values

Sales tax exempt numbers : immediately
Sales tax reporting codes : immediately
Execution unit 2 and 3 should be run immediately

same units are run in sequence and different number units are run in parallel. but sequence in dominating filter so system 1st check sequence then check units. and there is no instruction for parallel run check yes or no, so by default parallel check is No.
According to above logic. system go and check sequence 1 and pick unit 1, 
import Sales Tax code name.
then check sequence 1 and unit 3 so condition is false
then go to sequence 2 and unit 1
import Tax code values.
then go sequence 2 and unit 2 condition false
go to sequence 4 unit 1
import sale tax code limit
then go to sequence 1 unit 3 condition false
go to sequence 2 unit 2
then import sales tax exempt number
and last import will be Sales tax reporting code.

'In order to successfully import sales tax codes and groups, the sales tax codes and details have to be loaded first, before sales tax groups can be imported. Sales tax codes and groups are all in Execution unit = 1, but the sequences are in the order that they will be imported. Other related sales tax entities that are not dependent upon other data entities being loaded are included in the package. For example, sales tax exempt numbers is set in its own Execution unit = 2. This data entity will start loading immediately because there are no dependencies on other entities loading before it.' 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities-data-packages

Execution units 2 and 3 have not been given dependencies in the list of answers, and should therefore run immediately.

comments.content:
'Execution units, levels, and sequences:
The execution unit, level in the execution unit, and sequence of an entity help control the order that the data is exported or imported in.
Entities in different execution units are processed in parallel.
In each execution unit, entities are processed in parallel if they have the same level.
In each level, entities are processed according to their sequence number in that level.
After one level has been processed, the next level is processed.'
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-import-export-job

discussion.content: This was on the exam

"In order to successfully import sales tax codes and groups, the sales tax codes and details have to be loaded first, before sales tax groups can be imported. Sales tax codes and groups are all in Execution unit = 1, but the sequences are in the order that they will be imported. Other related sales tax entities that are not dependent upon other data entities being loaded are included in the package. For example, sales tax exempt numbers is set in its own Execution unit = 2. This data entity will start loading immediately because there are no dependencies on other entities loading before it." https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities-data-packages

Sales tax code names : immediately
Sales tax code values : After code names
Sales tax code limits : After sales tax code values

Sales tax exempt numbers : After code names
Sales tax reporting codes : immediately

comments.content: Sales tax code names: After Sales tax code names ( Sequence level 2 )? names after names?

discussion.content:
Sales tax code names: Immediately ( Sequence level 1 )
Sales tax code names: After Sales tax code names ( Sequence level 2 )
Sales tax code limits: After sales tax code values ( Sequence level 4 )
Sales tax exempt number: After sales tax code names ( Sequence level 2 )
Sales tax reporting codes: Immediately ( Sequence level 1 )

This should be the right answers, Because the UNITs are always immediately executed regardless, but how the data comes in depends on the sequence level.
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/data-entities/data-entities-data-packages
